GCC111912-d-11-19-12-GICX.Narrative: ON 11/19/12 THE RAIL CREW WAS ENTERING THE GRR LEAD WITH THE LOCOMOTIVE TRAILING A GROUP OF 8 FREIGHT CARS. THE GRR LEAD CONSIST OF TIGHT RADIUS CURVE WITH A SWITCH CONTAINED MIDWAY OF THE CURVE, WHICH LEADS INTO 2 ADDITIONAL SWITCHES SEPARATED BY AN INDUSTRY ROAD CROSSING. WHEN PUSHING THE 8 CARS THROUGH THE INITIAL CURVE, THE SECOND TRUCK OF THE THIRD CAR DERAILED JUST PAST THE INITIAL SWITCH. THE TRAIN CONSISTED OF TWO LOADED HAZARDOUS LIQUID TANK CARS, TWO EMPTY HOPPER CARS AND WAS BEING PUSHED BY THE LOCOMOTIVE. THERE WERE NO RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS LIQUID FROM THE RAILCARS OR THE LOCOMOTIVE. AFTER THE DERAILMENT A 12" PIECE OF THE SWITCH POINT, ABOUT 2" IN WIDTH WAS FOUND LAYING ON THE TRACKS. BASED ON OBSERVATIONS OF BOTH EMPLOYEES INVOLVED IT WAS DETERMINED THAT DRUGS AND ALCOHOL WERENOT INVOLVED, AND TESTING WAS NOT WARRANTED. AFTER CONSULTING SEVERAL RAIL CONSULTANTS, IT WAS POINTED OUT THAT EMPTY CARS CONTAINED IN THE MIDDLE OF THIS CONSIST MAY HAVE INCREASED THE RISK OF DERAILMENT. WE HAVE SINCE IMPLEMENTED A POLICY WHICH ALLOWS NO MORE THAN ONE EMPTY CAR IN A CONSIST WHENPUSHING INTO THE GRR LEAD.

D111312-d-11-13-12-ASRY.Contributing Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Transverse/compound fissure   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
D111312-d-11-13-12-ASRY.Narrative: 30. YARD LIMITS. AUTOMATIC INTERLOCKING IN YARD LIMITS. AT 05:15 A.M. ON NOVEMBER 13, 2012; THE CREWOF WT-3 WAS PROCEEDING EASTBOUND THROUGH PLYMOUTH YARD LIMITS WITH 27 CARS CONSISTING OF 14 LOADS AND 13 EMPTIES. THE TRAIN WAS APPROACHING THE HOME SIGNAL PROTECTING THE ASHLAND RAILWAY AND THE WHEELING AND LAKE ERIE RAILROAD CROSSING AT GRADE. A SIGNAL INDICATION TO PROCEED WAS RECEIVED BY THE CREW AND MOVEMENT CONTINUED THROUGH THE INTERLOCKING. THE HEAD END CLEARED THE DIAMOND BY ABOUT 4 TO 5CAR LENGTHS WHEN A TRAIN LINE INITIATED WALKING PROTECTION OF THE TRAIN. AS THE CONDUCTOR REACHED THE REAR END OF THE TRAIN, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE LAST 5 CARS OF THE TRAIN HAD DERAILED TO THE INSIDEOF THE CURVE. CAUSE OF DERAILMENT: CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE DERAILMENT INDICATED THAT LOADED BOX CAR LRS15240 DERAILED TO THE INSIDE OF THE CURVE DUE TO A BROKEN RAIL ON THE INSIDE OR LOW RAIL. DERAILMENTOF THE FIRST CAR CAUSED THE RAIL ON THE HIGH SIDE TO TURN OVER THE OUTSIDE DERAILING FIRST ECUX 882336, WHICH WAS AHEAD OF LRS 15240, AND THEN EMPTY NOKL 533364. AFTER  NOKL 533364 DERAILED IT WAS FOLLOWED BY LOADED CAR KCS 130331 AND THEN EMPTY NOKL 533452. AS THE LOADED KCS 130331 DERAILED IT WENT TO THE OUTSIDE OF THE INSIDE RAIL, RAN OFF THE ENDS OF TIES AND DRAGGED THE TWO EMPTY CARS WITH ITWHEN IT TILTED OVER AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE AGAINST THE SIDE OF A LOW CUT. THE EAST SIDE OF THE BROKENRAIL WAS BATTERED TO THE POINT THAT NO EVIDENCE REMAINED TO INDICATE WHAT CAUSED THE RAIL TO BREAK.

MT1112106-d-11-25-12-BNSF.Narrative: G-GRFGRF1-24, WHILE PULLING INTO GREAT FALLS FROM FT. BENTON SUBDIVISION, DERAILED 2 CARS WHEN STOPPING FOR SWITCH.  CREW APPLIED DYNAMIC BRAKES WHILE REAR OF TRAIN WAS ROUNDING A CURVE, CREATING ENOUGH SLACK TO DERAIL REAR 2 CARS OF TRAIN.

1112NP006-d-11-12-12-UP.Narrative: THE YND36X-12 WAS PULLING A LOADED GRAIN TRAIN OUT OF THE AG VALLEY COOPERATIVE TRACK 806 WHEN THREECARS DERAILED. AG VALLY COOPERATIVE WAS UNABLETO DETERMINE WHICH OF THEIR EMPLOYEES WERE THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO RUNNING THRU THE SWITCH.  AG VALLEY COOPERATIVE MAINTAINS TRACK.  TRACK DAMAGE = $22,000.00

1112PC002-d-11-05-12-UP.Narrative: LCT49-05 CONDUCTOR AND STUDENT WALKED THE LINEUP DOWN THE LEAD.  CONDUCTOR AND STUDENT POSITIONED AHEAD OF THE MOVEMENT AND AT THE JOINT INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK TEN CARS.  THE TRAIN DIDNOT GO DOWN THE INTENDED ROUTE MAKING A HARD COUPLE IN 4 CAR LENGTHS INSTEAD OF TEN CARS RESULTING IN A DERAILMENT. THE TRAIN WAS MOVING ABOVE MAX SPEED FOR TRACK CLASS AT THE TIME OF INCIDENT.
